us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame

Class FrameGeometryObject<F extends FrameGeometryObject<F,G>,G extends us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<G>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.FrameGeometryObject<F,G>
  • Type Parameters:
    F - the final type of the extension of this abstract class.
    G - the final type of the geometry object to be used with this frame geometry object.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<F>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<F>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<F>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<F>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable, ReferenceFrameHolder

    public abstract class FrameGeometryObject<F extends FrameGeometryObject<F,G>,G extends us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<G>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReferenceFrameHolder, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<F>
    FrameGeometryObject is the base implementation of a general GeometryObject associated with a ReferenceFrame.

    Once initialized in a given reference frame, the geometry object can be transformed such that the transformation represents the same geometry object viewed from another reference frame perspective.

        protected ReferenceFrame referenceFrame

    • Constructor Detail

      • FrameGeometryObject

        public FrameGeometryObject(G geometryObject)
        Creates a new frame geometry object.

        The given geometryObject's reference is saved internally for performing all the future operations with this FrameGeometryObject.

        The reference frame is initialized to ReferenceFrame.getWorldFrame().

        Parameters:
        geometryObject - the geometry object that is to be used internally. Reference saved. Will be modified.

      • FrameGeometryObject

        public FrameGeometryObject(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame,
                           G geometryObject)
        Creates a new frame geometry object and initializes its current reference frame.

        The given geometryObject's reference is saved internally for performing all the future operations with this FrameGeometryObject.

        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the initial reference frame in which the given geometry object is expressed in.
        geometryObject - the geometry object that is to be used internally. Reference saved. Will be modified.

      • set

        public final void set(G geometryObject)
        Copies the values from the given geometryObject into the geometry object in this.

        Note that not reference frame check can be performed. If possible, prefer using other methods and taking in either a ReferenceFrame or another FrameGeometryObject.

        Parameters:
        geometryObject - the geometry object used to update the geometry object in this. Not modified.

      • set

        public final void set(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame,
                      G geometryObject)
        Copies the values from the given geometryObject into the geometry object in this.

        The reference frame passed in, represents the coordinate system in which geometryObject is expressed. This method ensures that the current reference frame in this is equal to referenceFrame. If the two reference frames differ, this method throws a ReferenceFrameMismatchException. If instead of throwing an exception this object's frame should be changed, use setIncludingFrame(ReferenceFrame, GeometryObject).

        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the coordinate system in which geometryObject is expressed.
        geometryObject - the geometry object used to update the geometry object in this. Not modified.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if this.referenceFrame != referenceFrame.

      • setIncludingFrame

        public final void setIncludingFrame(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame,
                                    G geometryObject)
        Copies the values from the given geometryObject into the geometry object in this and changes this reference frame to referenceFrame.

        The reference frame passed in, represents the coordinate system in which geometryObject is expressed.

        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the coordinate system in which geometryObject is expressed.
        geometryObject - the geometry object used to update the geometry object in this. Not modified.

      • set

        public final void set(F other)
        Sets the geometry object in this to the geometry object in other.

        Before updating the geometry object in this, this method ensures that the reference frames currently associated with this and other match. If the two reference frames differ, this method throws a ReferenceFrameMismatchException. If instead of throwing an exception this object's frame should be changed, use setIncludingFrame(FrameGeometryObject).

        Specified by:
        set in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<F extends FrameGeometryObject<F,G>>
        Parameters:
        other - the other frame geometry object used to update the geometry object in this. Not modified.

      • setIncludingFrame

        public final void setIncludingFrame(F other)
        Sets both the reference frame and geometry object in this to other's reference frame and geometry object.
        Parameters:
        other - the other frame geometry object used to update this. Not modified.

      • setFromReferenceFrame

        public final void setFromReferenceFrame(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame)
        Sets this frame geometry object to zero to the given reference frame, then changes back to this frame geometry object's current frame.

        Practically, this method can be used to store the transformation information from referenceFrame to this current reference frame into this geometry object. How the information is stored depends on the type of the geometry object. For instance, if the geometry object is a Point3D, information retained from the transformation is the translation part only.

        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the reference frame of interest.

      • changeFrame

        public void changeFrame(ReferenceFrame desiredFrame)
        This is the main feature of a FrameGeometryObject:

        Transforms this geometry object such that the transformation represents the same geometry but from the perspective of another reference frame: desiredFrame. Once the geometry object is transformed, the reference frame is updated to desiredFrame. In the case, this.referenceFrame == desiredFrame, this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        desiredFrame - the reference frame in which the geometry object is to be expressed.

      • epsilonEquals

        public final boolean epsilonEquals(F other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Tests on a per component basis if this and other are equal to an epsilon.

        First tests if this and other are currently expressed in the same reference frame, if not, this returns false. Then, tests if this.geometryObject is equal to other.geometryObject to an epsilon. The test is usually achieved on a per component basis. Sometimes a failing test does not necessarily mean that the two objects are different in a geometric way.

        Specified by:
        epsilonEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<F extends FrameGeometryObject<F,G>>
        Parameters:
        other - the other object to compare against this. Not modified.
        epsilon - tolerance to use when comparing each component.
        Returns:
        true if the two objects are equal component-wise, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(F other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Tests if this and other represent the same geometry to an epsilon.

        This returns false if the two frame geometries are not expressed in the same reference frame.

        The implementation of this test depends on the type of geometry. For instance, two points will be considered geometrically equal if they are at a distance from each other that is less or equal than epsilon.

        Two frame geometries that are geometrically equal are not necessarily epsilon equals and vice versa.

        Specified by:
        geometricallyEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<F extends FrameGeometryObject<F,G>>
        Parameters:
        other - the other geometry object to compare against this. Not modified.
        epsilon - tolerance to use when comparing the two objects, usually refers to a distance.
        Returns:
        true if the two objects represent the same geometry, false otherwise.

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Tests if the given object's class is the same as this, in which case the method returns equals(FrameGeometryObject), it returns false otherwise.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        object - the object to compare against this. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if object and this are exactly equal, false otherwise.

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(F other)
        First, tests if this and other are currently expressed in the same reference frame, if not, this method returns false. Then, tests if this.geometryObject is exactly equal to other.geometryObject. The test is usually achieved on a per component basis. Sometimes a failing test does not necessarily mean that the two objects are different in a geometric way.
        Parameters:
        other - the other frame geometry object to compare against this. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two objects are exactly equal component-wise, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Provides a String representation of this frame geometry object.

        The returned String is the concatenation of the geometry object and reference frame String representations.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String representation of this frame geometry object.
